summary:
All parties are urged to cooperate with ONUB, ensure the safety and freedom of movement of UN personnel, and facilitate the return of refugees and internally displaced persons. 

The resolution stresses the importance of implementing the Arusha Agreement, promoting peace and national reconciliation, and fostering accountability and respect for human rights in Burundi. 

It also calls for the international financial institutions and the donor community to contribute to Burundi's economic development and urges the Secretary-General to ensure coordination between ONUB and MONUC. 

ONUB is to carry out its mandate in close cooperation with MONUC, particularly concerning cross-border movements and disarmament programs.
Requests the Secretary-General to regularly inform the Security Council of developments in Burundi, implementation of the Arusha Agreement, and ONUB's mandate execution, submitting a report every three months, including a military component strength evaluation for adjusted reduction; Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
